alert.note: Alert for Adams; Idaho; Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued March 10 at 7:14AM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Payette National Forest Avalanche Center. ...The Payette National Forest Avalanche Center in McCall Idaho has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area will rise to HIGH this morning. * WHERE...The West Central Idaho Mountains, including the mountains near McCall, New Meadows, Donnelly, and Cascade. * WHEN...in effect until 630 AM MST Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy snowfall combined with strong winds will overload recent soft snow. High avalanche danger is expected today. Large avalanches will become likely to very likely in many areas. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors or flat terrain. avoid slopes steeper than 30 degrees and avoid being near or underneath slopes steeper than 30 degrees. avalanches may be triggered remotely - from flat terrain above, below and the sides of steep slopes. Consult WWW.PAYETTEAVALANCHE.ORG or WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
